results.title: Life in the trees
results.creator_credit: John Sparks, Richard Attenborough, Reiner Moritz Productions, Warner Bros Pictures and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Life on Earth”.
David Attenborough examines the evolution of the primates. As well as looking at the better known members of the ape family - monkeys, gorillas and chimpanzees - it also looks at some of the lesser known cousins. This episode contains the memorable scene where David Attenborough meets a group of young mountain gorillas in Zaire.

results.title: Pride and prejudice
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, Chrysalis Films, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: Part 5 of a series on Australian women artists, examining some of their thoughts, struggles, aspirations, influences and disappointments, and the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping. Some of the women strongly believe in using their art as a form of political protest, but they all agree that their aim is to bring Australia out of the cultural desert and bring recognition to women generally as artists in their own right. The painters and sculptors include: Inge King, Margaret Hinder, Margaret Priest, Mirka Mora, Rinske Car, Anne Newmarch, Denese Oates, Kate Briscoe, Joan Grounds, Bonita Ely, Micky Allan and holographer, Margaret Benyon. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Jennings, Chrysalis Films, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks

results.title: Assertive skills training (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chrysalis Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This program uses a series of playlets to illustrate unassertive behaviour, the benefits resulting from assertive behaviour and better communication in personal interactions. The six segments are entitled; Work, Couples, Families, Conversations, Requests, Neighbours.

results.title: Don't just stand there coughing
results.creator_credit: Craig Lahiff, Gus Howard, South Australian Film Corporation and Seethru Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film is designed to show the causes and effects of air pollution. It offers possible remedies to improve the quality of the air we breathe. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Storm Boy
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Storm Boy is a 1976 Australian drama film based on the book of the same name by Colin Thiele, about a lonely boy and his pet pelicans living in a coastal wilderness with his reclusive father.

constellations_other.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_other.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Henri Safran, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.description: Three characters live in isolation amidst the coastal sand dunes of the Coorong in southern South Australia. In a shack on the beach live Tom, a fisherman, and his young son; out amongst the dunes lives an Indigenous man, ‘Fingerbone Bill’, who forms a friendship with the boy, naming him ‘Storm Boy’. The story is conveyed with simplicity, with events being left unspoken and undetailed. The relationships between the characters, and the scenes where the boy and his pet pelican play together are subtly sketched. Burton’s photography effectively captures the wild beauty of the Coorong.
description_for_label: Three characters live in isolation amidst the coastal sand dunes of the Coorong in southern South Australia. In a shack on the beach live Tom, a fisherman, and his young son; out amongst the dunes lives an Indigenous man, ‘Fingerbone Bill’, who forms a friendship with the boy, naming him ‘Storm Boy’. The story is conveyed with simplicity, with events being left unspoken and undetailed. The relationships between the characters, and the scenes where the boy and his pet pelican play together are subtly sketched. Burton’s photography effectively captures the wild beauty of the Coorong.

results.title: No going back
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, Chrysalis Films, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: This film sensitively explores the extreme problems of social adjustment experienced by people newly released from prison. After several years of confinement within an ordered monochrome prison life, the outside world is a noisy busy place. Housing, money, wives, defactos, children, a job - all have to be sorted out within a short time if the ex-prisoner is not going to fall back on old ways, old friends, and the same situations which led to prison in the first place. Cast includes Chris Haywood, Richard Moir, Jennifer Scott-Roberts, Geraldine Smedley and Ellen Freeman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Jennings, Chrysalis Films, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks

results.title: Restoring the past
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Bosisto Productions, South Australian Film Corporation and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: Examines correct and incorrect procedures in restoring old buildings. The audience is taken on an informative journey around Adelaide historic buildings, where restoration is looked at through the many errors that have been made and the current restoration of a number of buildings under the guidance of the Australian Mineral Development Laboratories. Great footage of early South Australian buildings.

results.title: Injury in sport
results.creator_credit: Newfilms and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Using live-action, animation and diagrams, this film clearly outlines many forms of sporting injuries to the bones, joints, ligaments, tendons, muscles and head. Briefly covers treatment and preventive measures.

results.title: Beat the heat: energy efficient housing
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram, Telefeatures, South Australian Film Corporation and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: A film designed to show the general public how, by the use of insulation, correct orientation of a house, placement of windows, etc., the unpleasant effects of intensive summer heat can be alleviated.

results.title: The Role of the Coach
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Bosisto Productions, South Australian Film Corporation and John Dick
results.brief_description: A training film to be used as a discussion starter in the development of new and practising coaches. Emphasises the aims of coaching, the different styles of coaching and individual reasons for involvement.
